intro: Penstemon brevisepalus, commonly known as the short-stamen beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing vibrant pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Penstemon brevisepalus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
